metadata.title: CVE-2021-38166 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In kernel/bpf/hashtab.c in the Linux kernel through 5.13.8, there is aninteger overflow and out-of-bounds write when many elements are placed in asingle bucket. NOTE: exploitation might be impractical without theCAP_SYS_ADMIN capability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
